intro: Polycarpaea robbairea subsp. robbairea, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats.
